thread.title: Storm Doris brings strong winds and rain on Thursday
thread.title_full: Storm Doris brings strong winds and rain on Thursday | Granada - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Storm Doris brings strong winds and rain on Thursday
text:
Gusts of up to 80mph are set to hit the country's shores as Storm Doris arrives from the Atlantic, the Met Office has said.
The storm will bring strong winds and heavy rain to parts of the North West when it arrives on Thursday.
Kerrie Gosney @kerriegosneyTV Follow WARNINGS out for Thursday. Storm DORIS now named Snow over hills 60mph wind gusts AMBER for the NW 70+mph possibl… https://t.co/a8k9pab26u
10:36 - 21 Feb 2017 Retweet Reply Favourite We have got a fairly active area of low pressure coming in from the Atlantic. It is strengthening as it moves eastwards to the UK.
– Met Office forecaster Emma Sharples The Met Office's amber weather warning alerts people that:
Whilst the strongest winds look to be only short-lived, damage to structures, interruptions to power supplies and widespread disruption to travel networks are likely, with a danger of injury from flying debris.
– Met Office Storm Doris is expected to move on quickly, with the worst of the weather gone by Thursday evening.
While further Atlantic gusts will bring more rain and wind through the weekend and into next week, they are not expected to reach the heights of Doris.
 Weather North West
